trans-unit.source: Provides options for controlling the rendering behavior of objects.
You can use the attached properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions> class to specify options for the rendering of text and visual elements in your WPF application.
These options enable you to optimize rendering for speed or quality.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.BitmapScalingMode"></xref> attached property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMaximum"></xref> attached property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMinimum"></xref> attached property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CachingHint"></xref> attached property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.ClearTypeHint"></xref> attached property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.EdgeMode"></xref> attached property.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.BitmapScalingMode"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object from which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.BitmapScalingMode"></xref> attached property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.BitmapScalingMode"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
The specified target is `null`.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMaximum"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object from which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMaximum"></xref> attached property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMaximum"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
The specified target is `null`.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMinimum"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object from which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMinimum"></xref> attached property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMinimum"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
The specified target is `null`.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CachingHint"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object from which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CachingHint"></xref> attached property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CachingHint"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
The specified target is `null`.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.ClearTypeHint"></xref> attached property of the specified element.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyObject"></xref> to retrieve the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.ClearTypeHint"></xref> attached property for.
The value of the attached property for target.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.EdgeMode"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The default value for non-text drawing primitives, such as <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Ellipse> and <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Polygon>, is <xref:System.Windows.Media.EdgeMode.Unspecified>.
The dependency object from which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.EdgeMode"></xref> attached property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.EdgeMode"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
The specified target is `null`.
Specifies the render mode preference for the current process.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.ProcessRenderMode%2A> property to force software rendering for the current process.
You can avoid many rendering issues that occur in WPF applications and that are caused by external issues if you change your preference to software rendering.
During application startup, if your application detects rendering issues, such as slow frame rates, you can set the rendering mode to software only.
Also, you may want to enable the user setting while the application is running.
The <xref:System.Windows.Interop.RenderMode.SoftwareOnly> preference overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndTarget.RenderMode%2A> setting.
The precedence order for software rendering is:
DisableHWAcceleration registry key
<xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndTarget.RenderMode%2A> (per-target)
**Note** <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.ProcessRenderMode%2A> specifies a preference and does not necessarily change the actual rendering mode.
Other parts of the system may override this preference and force the system into software rendering.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.RenderMode"></xref> preference for the current process.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.BitmapScalingMode"></xref> attached property on a specified dependency object.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.SetBitmapScalingMode%2A> method on a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.DrawingGroup> descendant that is animating a bitmap.

When animating the scale of any bitmap, the default high-quality image re-sampling algorithm can sometimes consume sufficient system resources to cause frame rate degradation, effectively causing animations to stutter.

By setting the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.BitmapScalingMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions> object to <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapScalingMode.LowQuality>, you can create a smoother animation when scaling a bitmap.

The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.DrawingGroup"></xref> descendant on which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.BitmapScalingMode"></xref> property.
The new value to set the property to.
The specified target is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMaximum"></xref> attached property on a specified dependency object.
Use this method to set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMaximum%2A> attached property in code.
The dependency object on which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMaximum"></xref> property
The new value to set the property to.
The specified target is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMinimum"></xref> attached property on a specified dependency object.
Use this method to set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMinimum%2A> attached property in code.
The dependency object on which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMinimum"></xref> property
The new value to set the property to.
The specified target is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CachingHint"></xref> attached property on a specified dependency object.

By default, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] does not cache the rendered contents of <xref:System.Windows.Media.DrawingBrush> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush> objects.
In static scenarios, where neither the contents nor the use of the brush in the scene is changing, not caching provides a benefit because it conserves video memory.

When a brush with static content is used in a non-static way, the default behavior of [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] is to re-render all the content of the brush every frame, even though the content is unchanging.
For example, this will happen when a static <xref:System.Windows.Media.DrawingBrush> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush> is mapped to the surface of a rotating 3D object.
Re-rendering the static content can have a negative impact on performance.

By setting the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CachingHint%2A> attached property of the brush to <xref:System.Windows.Media.CachingHint.Cache>, you can increase performance by using cached versions of the tiled brush objects.

The <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMinimum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMaximum%2A> property values are relative-size values that determine when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> object should be regenerated because of changes in scale.

For example, when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CacheInvalidationThresholdMaximum%2A> property is set to 2.0, the cache for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TileBrush> needs to be regenerated only when its size exceeds two times the size of the current cache.
Use this method to set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CachingHint%2A> attached property in code.
The dependency object on which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.CachingHint"></xref> property.
The new value to set the property to.
The specified target is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.ClearTypeHint"></xref> attached property of the specified element.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyObject"></xref> to set the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.ClearTypeHint"></xref> attached property on.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.ClearTypeHint"></xref> value.
The specified target is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.EdgeMode"></xref> attached property on a specified dependency object.
Text objects are always displayed with anti-aliasing, and are unaffected by setting the edge mode value.
When you set the edge mode value of a visual object, all the descendant drawing primitives of the visual object are set to the same edge mode value.
The dependency object on which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.RenderOptions.EdgeMode"></xref> property
The new value to set the property to.
The specified target is `null`.
